meanings.definition: To move one's hand or an object back and forth against a surface.
meanings.sent1: She rubs the table to clean off the dust.
meanings.sent2: He rubs his eyes when he wakes up in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The cat rubs against the door to ask for attention.
meanings.sent4: The waves rub against the shore, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: Rubbing the balloon against your hair can make it stick to the wall.

meanings.definition: To apply pressure and friction to a part of the body to relieve pain or stiffness.
meanings.sent1: Mom rubs my back to help me relax before bed.
meanings.sent2: Athletes often rub their muscles after a tough workout.
meanings.sent3: The robot rubs its circuits to ease its electronic pain.
meanings.sent4: The hiker's sore feet felt better after rubbing them gently.
meanings.sent5: Rubbing the sore spot on your arm can make it feel better.

meanings.definition: A substance used to season or flavor meat before cooking.
meanings.sent1: She added the rub to the chicken before grilling it.
meanings.sent2: The chef's special rub gave the steak a delicious flavor.
meanings.sent3: The magical rub made the bland dish taste amazing.
meanings.sent4: The secret rub recipe made the ribs mouth-watering.
meanings.sent5: The BBQ rub coated the meat with a tasty blend of spices.
